content: I noticed that there is a note in a bullet point in on the Data Types page that asserts that "GFM prohibits Raw HTML". This is inaccurate. GFM does allow the inclusion of raw HTML and has an extension that prohibits the use a particular set of HTML tags. Is it the intention that the markdown data type does prohibit all raw HTML or simply that the FHIR markdown type adhere to GFM?
hmm. It is certainly meant to mean 'no raw html'
@Michael Faughn, can you use the 'propose a change' link at the bottom of the FHIR spec to request that this be clarified? (You can include a link to this stream.)
